data.title: 35 Facts About The Movie We Bought A Zoo
data.meta_description: Dive deep into 35 fascinating facts about the heartwarming movie We Bought a Zoo. Explore behind-the-scenes trivia and more in this comprehensive guide.
data.text:
We Bought a Zoo was released in 2011.

This heartwarming family drama, directed by Cameron Crowe, made its debut in 2011, captivating audiences with its touching storyline and stellar performances.

The movie is based on a memoir by Benjamin Mee.

"We Bought a Zoo" is inspired by the real-life experiences of Benjamin Mee, who documented his journey of purchasing and renovating a dilapidated zoo in his memoir titled "We Bought a Zoo: The Amazing True Story of a Young Family, a Broken Down Zoo, and the 200 Wild Animals that Changed Their Lives."

Matt Damon stars as the protagonist.

In the film, Academy Award-winning actor Matt Damon portrays the central character, Benjamin Mee, a widowed father who decides to start anew by purchasing a struggling zoo as a means of healing and providing a fresh start for his family.

The movie's setting is a real zoo.

The story unfolds within the confines of the Dartmoor Zoological Park in Devon, England, which adds an authentic and immersive dimension to the film's narrative.

Scarlett Johansson portrays the head zookeeper.

Renowned actress Scarlett Johansson takes on the role of Kelly Foster, the dedicated and compassionate head zookeeper who assists Benjamin Mee in his ambitious endeavor to revitalize the zoo.

The movie showcases the challenges of zoo ownership.

"We Bought a Zoo" poignantly illustrates the myriad challenges and obstacles faced by the Mee family as they navigate the complexities of zoo management and animal care.

The film explores themes of love, loss, and resilience.

Through its poignant storytelling, the movie delves into profound themes of love, loss, and the indomitable human spirit, resonating with audiences on a deeply emotional level.
